Hell on Wheels: Witaj w piekle

Hell on Wheels: Witaj w piekle Poland
akas from release info: La bataille du rail Canada (French title) (DVD title)
Hell on Wheels: L'Enfer de l'Ouest France
Hell on Wheels: Witaj w piekle Poland

1.title: Chinatown
1.plot: Cullen finds a route through the mountains to Ogden, Utah.

2.title: Mei Mei
2.plot: Cullen enlists new workers to help him move a locomotive on a sled; Cullen and Fong must work together; Swede and Phineas fight for survival after being banished to the high country.

3.title: White Justice
3.plot: Cullen contends with violence in Chinatown set off by disgruntled railroad workers. The Swede manipulates Phineas in his plot against the Mormons.

4.title: Struck
4.plot: In the wake of the violence, Cullen solves a Chinese labor strike; Mickey is pulled deeper into Union Pacific Business.

5.title: Elixir of Life
5.plot: Unexpected violence strikes during the festival of Tin Hau Don in Chinatown. Cullen confronts The Swede. Durant involves Maggie in his latest scheme.

6.title: Hungry Ghosts
6.plot: Cullen and Mei take a dangerous journey through the California wilderness, escorting precious cargo. Eva nurses Louise back to health.

7.title: False Prophets
7.plot: Cullen and Durant discuss with President Grant what will be the future of the railroad; The Swede goes ahead with his plan against the Mormons.

8.title: Two Soldiers
8.plot: The premiere sees the Swede's murderous rampage on the Hatch homestead resulting in a long overdue showdown with Cullen.

9.title: Return to the Garden
9.plot: Cullen faces life-changing decisions in Utah as Truckee adapts to life without him.

10.title: 61 Degrees
10.plot: Cullen's nitroglycerin experiment provides an explosive backdrop for the railroad life in Truckee. Durant's plan turns deadly.

11.title: Gambit
11.plot: Durant's plot to ransom himself takes an unexpected turn when Campbell arrives in town with the Cavalry to coordinate a rescue operation.

12.title: Any Sum Within Reason
12.plot: Chang discovers Mei's secret and forces her to flee Truckee. Cullen's search for her brings new realizations while exorcising old demons.

13.title: Railroad Men
13.plot: The race to Ogden is coming to an end but when Cullen find out that the workers are missing it seems impossible to finish first.

14.title: Done
14.plot: Government hearings, incalculable actions and the golden spike breed new beginnings and endings for those left standing.

1.title: Pilot
1.plot: A former confederate soldier journeys to the transcontinental railroad to seek vengeance.

2.title: Immoral Mathematics
2.plot: Cullen fights for his life as he answers for his deadly actions. Lily struggles to survive in the wilderness, as Durant attempts to spin tragedy for political gain.

3.title: A New Birth of Freedom
3.plot: Cullen's search for the sergeant is diverted by an unexpected obstacle. Durant organizes a search party to retrieve the missing Lily Bell.

4.title: Jamais je ne t'oublierai
4.plot: Cullen closes in on the Sergeant. Durant pursues a hidden agenda while helping Lily recuperate.

5.title: Bread and Circuses
5.plot: Joseph Black Moon and Reverend Nathaniel Cole travel into Cheyenne territory in hopes of a peace talk. Lily Bell and Thomas Durant discuss the future of the railroad construction. Cullen Bohannon and Elam settle their differences in a public fight.

6.title: Pride, Pomp and Circumstance
6.plot: Durant attempts to end ongoing negotiations with the Cheyenne by challenging them to a competition.

7.title: Revelations
7.plot: Durant and Lily travel to Chicago - he, to further discuss the railroad with Senator Crane; she, to meet with her deceased husband's family. The Irishmen from Hell On Wheels prepare to hang Elam. Cullen interferes and helps him escape.

8.title: Derailed
8.plot: A train is derailed by the Cheyenne. Durant orders Cullen to lead a team to track them. Lily moves out of Durant's coach and into her own tent beside the brothel. Tension mounts for Cullen's team in the pursuit of the renegade Indian tribe.

9.title: Timshel
9.plot: Cullen and the search party find the natives who attacked the surveyor's camp and later derailed a train; Elam and Eva discuss their future, before getting a strange visitor; and the railroad crew reaches the important 40-mile mark.

10.title: God of Chaos
10.plot: Durant and Lily conspire to gain investors' interests. Sean and Mickey McGinnes exact their own revenge on The Swede. Elam and Eva each begin to see the future differently. Cullen tracks down the elusive Sergeant Harper.

1.title: Viva La Mexico
1.plot: Cullen and Elam find themselves on opposite sides of the law as Durant and Lily push the railroad further west.

2.title: Durant, Nebraska
2.plot: Durant must confront a dangerous threat to Hell On Wheels. Meanwhile, a horrible crime forces Lily and Elam to strike a deal to bring justice.

3.title: Slaughterhouse
3.plot: Mickey and Sean's life hangs in the balance as Cullen tries to keep order.

4.title: Scabs
4.plot: After tragedy strikes one of their own, Cullen must diffuse an internal threat to the railroad.

5.title: The Railroad Job
5.plot: Cullen's past haunts Hell on Wheels, leaving the fate of the railroad hanging in the balance.

6.title: Purged Away with Blood
6.plot: Durant must save the railroad while fighting for his own life. Meanwhile Cullen fights to save an old friend.

7.title: The White Spirit
7.plot: Cullen seeks justice in the aftermath of tragedy.

8.title: The Lord's Day
8.plot: A new arrival in Hell on Wheels creates turmoil.

9.title: Blood Moon
9.plot: As the town celebrates, Cullen prepares for battle and then fights to save the railroad.

10.title: Blood Moon Rising
10.plot: As the town celebrates, Cullen prepares for battle and then fights to save the railroad.

1.title: Big Bad Wolf
1.plot: After a hard winter, Cullen and Elam travel to New York to secure their positions on the railroad as Durant fights for his legacy from prison.

2.title: Eminent Domain
2.plot: An unexpected roadblock forces Cullen to make a difficult choice as a reporter arrives in Hell on Wheels. Elam struggles with his new boss.

3.title: Range War
3.plot: Cullen and Elam search for their stolen food on the prairie; a stranger's arrival threatens Elam's family.

4.title: The Game
4.plot: Cullen and Elam try to secure a new lumber source following a railroad accident; Durant tells Louise a secret about Cullen.

5.title: Searchers
5.plot: Cullen helps Elam track down a dangerous criminal; the town prepares to move down the tracks.

6.title: One Less Mule
6.plot: Durant files an injunction against Union Pacific, threatening Cullen's position; Elam deals with a dangerous newcomer.

7.title: Cholera
7.plot: A cholera epidemic breaks; Cullen must locate fresh water before his employees perish; Durant faces political fallout.

8.title: It Happened in Boston
8.plot: Cullen seeks help from Durant in winning his workers back from the Mormons; Sean and Mickey are haunted by their past.

9.title: Fathers and Sins
9.plot: With General Grant's deadline only two days away, a gang of riders attacks Cheyenne while Cullen and Elam pay Durant a visit.

10.title: Get Behind the Mule
10.plot: Cullen deals with consequences; Elam mounts a rescue attempt; Durant receives the U.P. board ahead of the deadline.

1.title: The Elusive Eden
1.plot: Cullen awaits the birth of his baby, laboring under The Swede's thumb at Fort Smith. Durant deals with the fallout from a railroad accident.

2.title: Escape from the Garden
2.plot: Cullen challenges The Swede as he plans his exit from Fort Smith. A new adversary arrives and makes his presence felt in Cheyenne.

3.title: Chicken Hill
3.plot: Cullen returns to Cheyenne. After being considered dead his return is a shock for many. Bohannan meets a few old friends and makes new enemies whilst trying to get his old job back from Durant.

4.title: Reckoning
4.plot: Cullen attempts to find a way for the railroad to pass over the mountains for Durant. As a Mormon, Naomi has her own struggles settling into Cheyenne. Brother Hatch continues to suspect the Swede of fraud and murder.

5.title: Life's a Mystery
5.plot: The arrival of a dangerous stranger stirs up old feelings in Cullen and puts his family at risk. The Swede faces consequences at Fort Smith.

6.title: Bear Man
6.plot: We follow Bear Killer (Elam) as he is cared for by the Comanche after a bear fight. He becomes part of the tribe as they attack incoming blue coats. Bear Killers growing confusion forces him to seek out the railroad.

7.title: Elam Ferguson
7.plot: Durant seeks revenge for his attack. Bear Killer (Elam) returns to Cheyenne trying to sell the female slaves he has. Due to Campbells presence, Cullen and Eva attempt to convince Elam of where he is and what will happen if he sell slaves.

8.title: Under Color of Law
8.plot: Naomi's unrest forces Cullen to take her and William back to the Mormon settlement at Ft. Smith. Campbell deputizes several undesirables in response to the deaths of his Marshals. The Swede is forgiven for his wrong-doings.

9.title: Two Trains
9.plot: Cullen attempts to make a stand to free Durant and the rest of the prisoners after Campbell decides to transport them back east. The only thing standing in his way is Snow and his men.

10.title: Return to Hell
10.plot: Cullen, Durant and Campbell come together in order to discuss a means by which to provide protection to the citizens of Cheyenne. They must return a sense of well-being to the town after a disturbing act of violence takes place.

11.title: Bleeding Kansas
11.plot: Cullen and Durant work together to save the life of a criminal; Louise supports Ruth as she copes with a loss.

12.title: Thirteen Steps
12.plot: Cullen struggles with Ruth's unexpected decision; Louise risks her reputation to fight for a story she believes in.

13.title: Further West
13.plot: As the railroad prepares to leave Cheyenne behind after Sherman Peak; Cullen returns to Fort Smith to get his family.

imdb.plot outline: Cullen Bohannon, a former soldier and slaveholder, follows the track of a band of Union soldiers, the killers of his wife. This brings him to the middle of one of the biggest projects in US history, the building of the transcontinental railroad. After the war years in the 1860s, this undertaking connected the prospering east with the still wild west.
imdb.title: Hell on Wheels

other companies.name: Alliance of Canadian Cinema, Television and Radio Artists (ACTRA)

plot: Cullen Bohannon, a former soldier and slaveholder, follows the track of a band of Union soldiers, the killers of his wife. This brings him to the middle of one of the biggest projects in US history, the building of the transcontinental railroad. After the war years in the 1860s, this undertaking connected the prospering east with the still wild west.::cc ardbeg

The show introduces real characters such as Thomas Durant, who was responsible for building the railroad from east to west. Bohannon may be the main character, but his adventures are cleverly woven amid real historical events and issues. There were hostilities among whites and recently freed slaves working on the rail line. There were also difficulties with the Irish crews, who weren't considered to be too much better, during those times. Of course there were also conflicts with Indians, who resented the crossing of their territory with total disregard of their sacred places. And of course there are difficulties with the building of the railroad itself, weather problems, difficult terrain, cheating officials, and late payrolls. Also shows the difficult lives of women in the era.::b gibson
